activities.loc: Br 10 - Law Enforcement Center - West Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shavale J Powell

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shavale J Powell in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Shavale J Powell. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Defense indicates they are still getting all the discovery so they have not yet hired an expert, requests a new JT date. 
State does not object to adjourning the JT date. 
BTC: Matter set over for status to address discovery.

11:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shavale J Powell not in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Shavale J Powell. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Matter set for plea/sentencing. 
Atty Henderson indicates the defendant may be confused with dates with his CM case, requests this track with the trial case but may resolve. 
State indicates they will talk about possible resolution. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive at all. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 4/19/2022 to all for GPS exceptions for confirmed and verified work search and employment.
AMENDED 05/23/22 DEFENDANT MAY BE REMOVED FROM GPS MONITORING

10:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shavale J Powell in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Shavale J Powell. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense requests matter be set over to another plea/ sentencing. defense moves to remove GPS monitoring for defendant. 
State objects with argument. 
BTC: Matter set over. Court to grant bond modification, GPS to be removed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
